2022 Winter Olympics opening ceremony

The 2022 Winter Olympics opening ceremony was held on 4 February 2022 at the Beijing National Stadium in Beijing, China. The ceremony was attended by dignitaries from around the world and marked the beginning of the 2022 Winter Olympics, the 24th edition of the Winter Games.

# Ceremony key team

The opening ceremony was directed by Zhang Yimou, a renowned Chinese film director, and choreographed by Shen Wei, a Chinese-born American choreographer. The ceremony's theme and concept were developed by a team led by Zhang Yimou, with input from the Beijing Organizing Committee for the 2022 Winter Olympics (BOCOG). The ceremony's production team consisted of over 10,000 people, including performers, technicians, and support staff.

# Theme and concept

The theme of the opening ceremony was "One World, One Family," reflecting the Olympic ideals of unity and solidarity. The ceremony's concept was centered around the idea of "rites of spring," symbolizing the arrival of winter and the beginning of a new cycle of life. The ceremony's narrative was structured around four chapters: "Rites of Spring," "The Beauty of Winter," "The Joy of Sports," and "The Unity of Humanity."

# Preparations

Preparations for the opening ceremony began several months in advance, with rehearsals taking place at the Beijing National Stadium from mid-January 2022. The ceremony's production team worked closely with the Beijing Organizing Committee to ensure that the ceremony met the Olympic Games' high standards. The ceremony's performers, including dancers, musicians, and athletes, underwent rigorous training and rehearsals to perfect their roles.

# Proceedings

The opening ceremony was a spectacular display of music, dance, and acrobatics, featuring a cast of over 3,000 performers. The ceremony was divided into several segments, each showcasing a different aspect of Chinese culture and Olympic values.

## Rites of spring: Countdown performance

The ceremony began with a countdown performance, featuring a group of dancers dressed in traditional Chinese clothing, who performed a synchronized routine to a medley of Chinese folk music. The countdown was displayed on a large screen at the center of the stadium, counting down the final minutes to the start of the ceremony.

## Entry of the National flag

Following the countdown, the Chinese national flag was carried into the stadium by a group of Chinese athletes, who were greeted by a standing ovation from the audience. The flag was raised to the national anthem, which was performed by a choir of Chinese singers.

## Olympic Rings Reveal

The Olympic rings were revealed in a dramatic display of fireworks and lighting, which lit up the night sky above the stadium. The rings were suspended above the stadium, and were slowly rotated to reveal the Olympic symbol.

## Parade of nations

The parade of nations followed, with athletes from each participating country marching into the stadium, led by their national flags. The athletes were dressed in their national uniforms, and were greeted by cheers and applause from the audience.

## Opening of the Olympic Games

The President of the People's Republic of China, Xi Jinping, declared the 2022 Winter Olympics open, marking the official start of the Games. The declaration was followed by a rendition of the Olympic anthem, which was performed by a choir of international singers.

## Tribute to the People

A tribute to the people of China followed, featuring a performance by a group of Chinese dancers and musicians, who showcased traditional Chinese music and dance. The performance was a celebration of Chinese culture and heritage.

## Olympic Flag Entry and Raising

The Olympic flag was carried into the stadium by a group of Olympic athletes, who were greeted by a standing ovation from the audience. The flag was raised to the Olympic anthem, which was performed by a choir of international singers.

## Oath taking

The Olympic oath was taken by a group of athletes, coaches, and judges, who pledged to uphold the Olympic values of fair play and sportsmanship. The oath was administered by the President of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), Thomas Bach.

## Snowflakes performance

A performance by a group of Chinese dancers and acrobats followed, featuring a display of snowflakes and winter scenery. The performance was a celebration of the beauty of winter and the magic of the Olympic Games.

## Arrival and lighting of the Olympic flame

The Olympic flame was carried into the stadium by a group of Chinese athletes, who lit the flame in a dramatic display of fireworks and lighting. The flame was lit by a group of Chinese athletes, who were greeted by a standing ovation from the audience.

# Anthems

The national anthems of China and the Olympic Games were performed during the ceremony, as well as the Olympic hymn.

# Dignitaries in attendance

The ceremony was attended by a number of dignitaries from around the world, including heads of state, government officials, and international sports leaders.

## Host nation

The President of the People's Republic of China, Xi Jinping, attended the ceremony, as well as other high-ranking Chinese officials.

## International

A number of international dignitaries attended the ceremony, including the President of the International Olympic Committee (IOC), Thomas Bach, and the Secretary-General of the United Nations, Ant√≥nio Guterres.

# Controversy and concerns

The 2022 Winter Olympics opening ceremony was not without controversy and concerns.

## Taiwan's participation

Taiwan's participation in the ceremony was a source of controversy, with the Taiwanese team marching under the name "Chinese Taipei" and the Chinese flag being displayed above the Taiwanese flag.

## Ratings on NBC network

The ceremony's ratings on the NBC network were lower than expected, with some commentators attributing the low ratings to the ceremony's early start time and the lack of American participation in the ceremony.

## Hanbok controversy

A controversy surrounding the use of traditional Korean clothing, known as hanbok, during the ceremony, with some commentators accusing the Chinese organizers of cultural appropriation.

Eknath Shinde

Eknath Shinde is an Indian politician who is the current Chief Minister of Maharashtra, a state in western India. He has been a member of the Shiv Sena party since its inception and has held various positions in the party and the state government. Shinde's rise to prominence was marked by his role in the 2022 Maharashtra political crisis, which led to his appointment as the Chief Minister of the state.

**Early life**

Eknath Shinde was born on February 9, 1964, in the town of Dare in the Palghar district of Maharashtra. His family was of modest means, and his father was a farmer. Shinde completed his primary education in his hometown and later moved to Thane for higher education. He graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree from the Yashwantrao Chavan Open University.

**Early political career**

Shinde's entry into politics was inspired by the ideology of the Shiv Sena party, which was founded by Balasaheb Thackeray. He was drawn to the party's nationalist and pro-Marathi agenda and soon became an active member of the party's local unit in Thane.

### Entry into politics

Shinde's first foray into politics was in the 1990s, when he contested and won the local municipal council elections in Thane. He later became a member of the Thane Municipal Corporation and served as its leader of the house. Shinde's performance in the corporation earned him recognition within the party, and he was soon appointed as the district chief of the Shiv Sena in Thane.

### Maharashtra Legislative Assembly & ministries

In 2004, Shinde contested the Maharashtra Legislative Assembly elections from the Kopri-Pachpakhadi constituency in Thane and won with a significant margin. He was re-elected to the assembly in 2009 and 2014 and became a key member of the Shiv Sena's legislative party.

Shinde has held various ministerial positions in the Maharashtra state government, including Minister of Public Works, Minister of Transport, and Minister of Urban Development. As a minister, he was known for his pragmatic approach and ability to work with other parties to achieve common goals.

**Role in 2022 Maharashtra political crisis**

In June 2022, Shinde was at the center of a major political crisis in Maharashtra. The crisis began when Shinde, who was then the leader of the Shiv Sena legislative party, rebelled against the party's leadership and formed a faction with a group of dissident MLAs. The faction, which came to be known as the Shiv Sena (Shinde Group), demanded greater autonomy and a more prominent role in the party.

The crisis deepened when Shinde and his faction joined forces with the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) and formed a new government in the state. Shinde was sworn in as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, marking a significant shift in the state's politics.

**Chief Minister**

As the Chief Minister of Maharashtra, Shinde has focused on implementing his party's agenda and addressing the state's development needs. He has announced several initiatives aimed at promoting economic growth, improving infrastructure, and enhancing the quality of life for citizens.

### Electoral performance

Shinde has contested several elections throughout his career, including local municipal council elections, state legislative assembly elections, and parliamentary elections. His electoral performance has been impressive, with a winning streak in the Kopri-Pachpakhadi constituency in Thane.

**Leader of Shiv Sena**

Shinde's rebellion against the Shiv Sena leadership in 2022 led to a dispute over the party's leadership. The Shiv Sena (Shinde Group) claims to be the authentic representative of the party, while the Uddhav Thackeray-led faction disputes this claim.

### Shiv Sena leadership dispute

The dispute over the Shiv Sena leadership has been marked by a series of court battles and public spats between the two factions. The dispute is yet to be resolved, with both factions claiming to be the legitimate representative of the party.

### Political legitimacy

Shinde's appointment as the Chief Minister of Maharashtra has been controversial, with some questioning the legitimacy of his government. Critics argue that Shinde's rebellion against the Shiv Sena leadership was undemocratic and that his government is not representative of the people's will.

**Personal life**

Shinde is married to Lata Shinde, and the couple has two sons and a daughter. He is known for his down-to-earth personality and is widely respected for his humility and simplicity.

**Popular culture**

Shinde's rise to prominence has been the subject of much media attention and public interest. He has been featured in several news programs and has been the subject of numerous articles and opinion pieces.

**References**

Barry Humphries

Barry Humphries AO, CBE is a renowned Australian comedian, actor, and satirist, best known for his alter egos Dame Edna Everage and Sir Les Patterson. With a career spanning over six decades, Humphries has established himself as one of the most iconic and influential figures in Australian entertainment.

# Early life

Barry Humphries was born on February 17, 1934, in Melbourne, Australia, to Eric and Louisa Humphries. He was the second of three children, and his family lived in the suburb of Camberwell. Humphries' early life was marked by a strong interest in the arts, and he began writing and drawing at a young age.

## Education

Humphries attended Camberwell Grammar School, where he developed his skills in writing and drawing. He later enrolled at the University of Melbourne, where he studied law, philosophy, and fine arts. However, Humphries did not complete his degree, instead choosing to pursue a career in the arts.

# Career

## Early career in Australia

Humphries began his career in the 1950s, working as a comedian and actor in Melbourne's theatre scene. He gained recognition for his impressions and character work, and soon became a regular on Australian radio and television. In the early 1960s, Humphries created his most famous character, Dame Edna Everage, a Melbourne housewife with a sharp tongue and a penchant for satire.

## London and the 1960s

In 1959, Humphries moved to London, where he became a key figure in the city's burgeoning satirical scene. He worked alongside other notable comedians, including Peter Cook and Jonathan Miller, and appeared in numerous stage shows and television programs. During this period, Humphries further developed his character work, introducing audiences to Sir Les Patterson, a boorish and lecherous Australian diplomat.

## 1970s

The 1970s saw Humphries achieve widespread success, both in Australia and internationally. He toured extensively with his one-man shows, which featured a range of characters, including Dame Edna and Sir Les. Humphries also began to appear in film, with roles in movies such as "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972) and "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974).

## Film roles

Humphries has appeared in numerous films throughout his career, often playing eccentric or satirical characters. Some of his most notable film roles include "The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert" (1994), "Spice World" (1997), and "Finding Nemo" (2003).

## One-man shows

Humphries has written and performed numerous one-man shows, which have toured extensively around the world. Some of his most notable shows include "A Night with Dame Edna" (1979), "An Evening with Sir Les Patterson" (1984), and "Eat Pray Laugh!" (2009).

## Television roles

Humphries has appeared in numerous television programs, including "The Dame Edna Experience" (1987-1988), "The Les Patterson Special" (1988), and "Da Kath and Kim Code" (2005). He has also made guest appearances on shows such as "The Simpsons" and "Absolutely Fabulous".

## Success in the United States

In the 1970s and 1980s, Humphries achieved significant success in the United States, particularly with his one-man shows. He became a regular on American television, appearing on programs such as "The Tonight Show" and "Saturday Night Live".

## Farewell tour

In 2012, Humphries embarked on his farewell tour, "Eat Pray Laugh!", which visited numerous cities around the world. The tour marked the end of Humphries' long and successful career as a performer.

## Weimar Cabaret

In 2016, Humphries curated a series of cabaret performances at the Barbican Centre in London, which explored the music and art of Weimar Germany. The performances featured a range of musicians and performers, and were accompanied by Humphries' own commentary and analysis.

# Characters

## Dame Edna Everage

Dame Edna Everage is Humphries' most famous character, a Melbourne housewife with a sharp tongue and a penchant for satire. Edna was created in the 1950s, and has since become a cultural icon in Australia and around the world.

## Sir Les Patterson

Sir Les Patterson is another of Humphries' most notable characters, a boorish and lecherous Australian diplomat. Les was created in the 1960s, and has appeared in numerous stage shows and television programs.

## Sandy Stone

Sandy Stone is a lesser-known character of Humphries', a gentle and eccentric Australian pensioner. Sandy has appeared in numerous one-man shows and television programs, and is known for his witty observations on life and aging.

# Personal life

## Views on transgenderism

In 2016, Humphries sparked controversy with his views on transgenderism, stating that he did not believe that transgender women were "women". Humphries later clarified his comments, stating that he was "not a fan of the word 'transgender'", but that he had "great respect" for individuals who identified as transgender.

## Death

Barry Humphries passed away on April 22, 2023, at the age of 89, after a long illness.

# Other work

## Bibliography

Humphries has written numerous books, including "Bizarre: A Biography" (1992), "More Please" (1993), and "My Life As Me" (2002).

## Filmography

Humphries has appeared in numerous films, including "The Adventures of Barry McKenzie" (1972), "Barry McKenzie Holds His Own" (1974), and "The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert" (1994).

## Discography

Humphries has released several albums, including "Wild Life" (1970) and "A Night with Dame Edna" (1979).

## Biographical studies

Several biographical studies have been written about Humphries, including "The Life and Times of Barry Humphries" (1995) and "Barry Humphries: The Authorized Biography" (2011).

## Fictional characters

Humphries has created numerous fictional characters throughout his career, including Dame Edna Everage, Sir Les Patterson, and Sandy Stone.

# Awards and honours

Humphries has received numerous awards and honours throughout his career, including an Order of Australia (1982) and a Commander of the Order of the British Empire (2000).

2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments

The 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments were a series of volleyball tournaments held in 2023 to determine the final teams that would qualify for the 2024 Summer Olympics in Paris, France. The tournaments were organized by the F√©d√©ration Internationale de Volleyball (FIVB) and featured six teams competing in each of the three pools. The top teams from each pool earned a spot in the 2024 Summer Olympics.

# Hosts selection

The FIVB selected the hosts for the 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments through a bidding process. China, Japan, and Poland were ultimately chosen as the hosts for the three pools. The selection was announced in 2022, giving the hosts a year to prepare for the tournaments.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments was based on the FIVB World Rankings as of September 2022. The top 24 teams in the rankings were eligible to participate in the qualification tournaments. The teams were divided into three pools of eight teams each, with the top two teams from each pool earning a spot in the 2024 Summer Olympics.

# Pools composition

The pools for the 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments were composed as follows:

Pool A: China, Italy, Netherlands, Poland, Serbia, South Korea, Thailand, and Turkey
Pool B: Japan, Brazil, Dominican Republic, Germany, Russia, United States, Argentina, and Belgium
Pool C: Poland, Canada, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Mexico, Puerto Rico, Slovenia, and Ukraine

# Venues

The pool standing procedure for the 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments was as follows:

* The teams were ranked based on the number of wins.
* In the event of a tie, the teams were ranked based on the number of points earned.
* If the tie persisted, the teams were ranked based on the number of sets won.
* If the tie still persisted, the teams were ranked based on the number of points earned in the sets won.

Each team was allowed to register a squad of 14 players for the 2023 FIVB Volleyball Women's Olympic Qualification Tournaments. The teams were required to submit their squads to the FIVB before the start of the tournaments.

article:
Edward Aveling
================

Edward Aveling (1851-1898) was a British biologist, Marxist, and playwright, best known for his work in popularizing Charles Darwin's theory of evolution and his association with Karl Marx and Friedrich Engels. Aveling was a prominent figure in the British secularist movement and a key figure in the development of Marxist thought in Britain.

Biography
---------

### Early years

Edward Aveling was born on November 29, 1851, in Stoke Newington, London, to a family of modest means. His father was a Congregationalist minister, and Aveling was raised in a devoutly Christian household. However, from an early age, Aveling began to question the tenets of Christianity, and by his teenage years, he had become an atheist.

### University College London

In 1870, Aveling enrolled at University College London (UCL), where he studied natural sciences, including biology, chemistry, and physics. During his time at UCL, Aveling became acquainted with the works of Charles Darwin and began to develop an interest in evolutionary theory. He graduated from UCL in 1874 with a degree in natural sciences.

### Cambridge

In 1875, Aveling moved to Cambridge, where he studied at King's College. During his time at Cambridge, Aveling became involved in the city's intellectual and cultural scene, attending lectures and meetings of the Cambridge Philosophical Society.

### College of Preceptors

In 1878, Aveling was appointed as a lecturer in natural sciences at the College of Preceptors, a teacher training college in London. It was during this period that Aveling began to develop his skills as a lecturer and writer, producing articles and pamphlets on scientific topics.

### First marriage

In 1880, Aveling married Isabel Campbell Frank, a woman of Scottish descent. The marriage was short-lived, and the couple separated in 1882.

### Lecturer on Comparative Anatomy at London Hospital

In 1882, Aveling was appointed as a lecturer in comparative anatomy at London Hospital Medical College. During his time at the hospital, Aveling taught students of medicine and developed his expertise in anatomy and physiology.

### New College, London

In 1884, Aveling was appointed as a lecturer in biology at New College, London, a secular institution that offered courses in science, literature, and philosophy.

### Professorship of English

In 1885, Aveling was appointed as professor of English at New College, London. During his tenure, Aveling taught courses in English literature and developed his skills as a playwright and critic.

### Aveling's secularist credo

Throughout his life, Aveling was committed to the principles of secularism and free thought. He believed that science and reason should be the guiding principles of human life, rather than superstition and dogma.

### National Secular Society and the Hall of Science

In 1880, Aveling became a member of the National Secular Society (NSS), an organization that advocated for the separation of church and state. Aveling was also a frequent lecturer at the Hall of Science, a popular venue for secularist meetings and events.

### Aveling as interim editor of Foote's Progress and The Freethinker

In 1883, Aveling became the interim editor of Foote's Progress, a radical journal that advocated for free thought and secularism. Aveling also edited The Freethinker, a weekly journal that promoted atheist and secularist views.

### Political career

Aveling was a committed socialist and member of the Social Democratic Federation (SDF), a Marxist organization that advocated for workers' rights and social justice.

### The American journey of agitation 1886

In 1888, Aveling returned to the United States, where he gave further lectures and speeches on socialism and free thought. During his time in America, Aveling became acquainted with the works of Henry George and the Single Tax movement.

Aveling was a great admirer of the Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen, and he translated several of Ibsen's plays into English. Aveling's wife, Eleanor Marx, was also a great admirer of Ibsen's work, and she translated several of his plays into English.

Aveling was a great admirer of Charles Darwin and his theory of evolution. Aveling often lectured on Darwin's theory and wrote articles and pamphlets on the subject.

Aveling was also a great admirer of the German biologist Ernst Haeckel, who was a prominent advocate of Darwin's theory in Germany. Aveling corresponded with Haeckel and translated several of his works into English.

### Aveling's publication of Darwin's letter to Marx

In 1880, Aveling published a letter written by Charles Darwin to Karl Marx, in which Darwin expressed his admiration for Marx's work and his desire to learn more about socialism.

### Later life, death and legacy

Aveling died on August 2, 1898, at the age of 46, due to complications from pneumonia. His legacy as a biologist, playwright, and advocate for free thought and socialism continues to be celebrated to this day.

article:
Assassination of John F. Kennedy

The assassination of John F. Kennedy, the 35th President of the United States, occurred on November 22, 1963, in Dallas, Texas. Kennedy was shot while riding in an open-top car in a motorcade through Dealey Plaza. The event shocked the nation and the world, and it remains one of the most significant and traumatic events in modern American history.

# Background

## Kennedy

John F. Kennedy was born on May 29, 1917, in Brookline, Massachusetts. He graduated from Harvard University in 1940 and served in the U.S. Navy during World War II. After the war, he entered politics, serving in the U.S. House of Representatives from 1947 to 1953 and in the U.S. Senate from 1953 to 1960. In 1960, he was elected president, defeating Republican candidate Richard Nixon. Kennedy's presidency was marked by significant events, including the failed Bay of Pigs invasion, the Cuban Missile Crisis, and the early years of the Vietnam War.

## Oswald

article:
Slim Whitman Discography

Otis Dewey Whitman Jr., known professionally as Slim Whitman, was an American country and western singer-songwriter and musician. With a career spanning over six decades, Whitman released numerous studio albums, live albums, compilation albums, and singles, making him one of the most prolific artists of his time. This article provides an overview of his extensive discography.

#Studio albums

Slim Whitman released 34 studio albums throughout his career, which includes his debut album "America's Favorite Folk Artist" in 1954 and his final studio album "Twilight on the Trail" in 2010.

##Early years (1950s)

Whitman's early studio albums were released on the RCA Victor label, including "America's Favorite Folk Artist" (1954), "Songs by Slim Whitman" (1955), and "Slim Whitman Sings" (1956). These albums were moderately successful, with "America's Favorite Folk Artist" reaching No. 8 on the Billboard Country Albums chart.

##Crossover success (1960s)

The 1960s saw Whitman's popularity soar with the release of albums such as "Just a Few Sweet Memories" (1961), "Slim Whitman Sings Annie Laurie" (1961), and "Irish Songs" (1962). These albums showcased Whitman's unique blend of country, folk, and pop music, appealing to a wider audience. "Just a Few Sweet Memories" reached No. 1 on the Billboard Country Albums chart, while "Irish Songs" reached No. 2 on the same chart.

##Later years (1970s-2010)

Whitman continued to release studio albums throughout the 1970s, 1980s, and 1990s, including "Everything Leads Back to You" (1970), "Guess Who" (1972), and "Red River Valley" (1977). His later albums, such as "Twilight on the Trail" (2010), featured a mix of classic and contemporary songs.

#Live albums

Slim Whitman released 10 live albums throughout his career, showcasing his energetic and charismatic stage presence.

##Early live recordings (1950s-1960s)

Whitman's early live albums, such as "Slim Whitman at the London Palladium" (1956) and "Slim Whitman Live" (1966), capture his performances in iconic venues, including the London Palladium and the Ryman Auditorium.

##Later live recordings (1970s-2000s)

Whitman's later live albums, such as "Slim Whitman's 20th Anniversary Concert" (1976) and "Slim Whitman Live in Branson" (2001), feature a mix of classic hits and new material. These albums demonstrate Whitman's enduring popularity and his ability to connect with audiences of all ages.

#Compilation albums

Slim Whitman released numerous compilation albums throughout his career, featuring a mix of his most popular songs and lesser-known tracks.

##Greatest hits collections (1960s-1980s)

Whitman's greatest hits collections, such as "The Best of Slim Whitman" (1966) and "Slim Whitman's Greatest Hits" (1970), feature his most iconic songs, including "Rose Marie" and "Indian Love Call".

##Themed compilations (1990s-2000s)

Whitman's later compilation albums, such as "Slim Whitman's Favorite Hymns" (1997) and "Slim Whitman's Christmas Album" (2000), feature themed collections of songs, showcasing his versatility and range.

#Singles (U.S.)

Slim Whitman released over 100 singles throughout his career, many of which reached the top 10 on the Billboard Country Singles chart.

##Early singles (1950s)

Whitman's early singles, such as "Love Song of the Waterfall" (1952) and "Indian Love Call" (1952), were moderately successful, with "Love Song of the Waterfall" reaching No. 10 on the Billboard Country Singles chart.

##Crossover success (1960s)

The 1960s saw Whitman's popularity soar with the release of singles such as "Rose Marie" (1960), which reached No. 1 on the Billboard Country Singles chart and No. 4 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart.

##Later singles (1970s-2000s)

Whitman's later singles, such as "Everything That's Me Is You" (1976) and "When" (1977), continued to chart on the Billboard Country Singles chart, demonstrating his enduring popularity.

#Singles (UK)

Slim Whitman's singles were also popular in the UK, with many reaching the top 10 on the UK Singles Chart.

##Early singles (1950s)

Whitman's early singles, such as "Love Song of the Waterfall" (1952) and "Indian Love Call" (1952), were moderately successful in the UK, with "Love Song of the Waterfall" reaching No. 9 on the UK Singles Chart.

##Crossover success (1960s)

The 1960s saw Whitman's popularity soar in the UK with the release of singles such as "Rose Marie" (1960), which reached No. 1 on the UK Singles Chart.

##Later singles (1970s-2000s)

Renaissance (Beyonc√© album)

Renaissance is the seventh studio album by American singer Beyonc√©, released on July 29, 2022, through Parkwood Entertainment and Columbia Records. The album is a celebration of freedom and joy, exploring themes of love, empowerment, and self-expression. It marks Beyonc√©'s first solo studio album since 2016's Lemonade.

# Background and conception

The creation of Renaissance began during the COVID-19 pandemic, when Beyonc√© found herself at home with her family, reflecting on her life and career. She described the album as "a journey of self-discovery" and "a chance to explore new sounds and styles." Beyonc√© worked on the album for over two years, writing and recording songs in various locations, including her home studio and rented studios in Los Angeles and New York City.

Beyonc√© has stated that she was inspired by her own experiences, as well as the music of her past, including disco, funk, and soul. She also drew inspiration from contemporary artists, such as Kendrick Lamar and Frank Ocean. The album features a diverse range of collaborators, including producers, songwriters, and musicians from various genres.

# Cover artwork

The cover artwork for Renaissance features a photo of Beyonc√© sitting on a horse, wearing a black leather corset and a flowing white skirt. The image was shot by photographer Carlijn Jacobs and styled by Marni Senofonte. The artwork has been interpreted as a symbol of freedom and empowerment, with the horse representing strength and independence.

# Composition

Renaissance is a genre-bending album that incorporates elements of disco, funk, soul, and Afrobeats, among other styles. The album's sound is characterized by lush instrumentation, catchy hooks, and introspective lyrics. The songs are often upbeat and celebratory, but also explore themes of love, heartbreak, and self-discovery.

The album features 16 tracks, including the singles "Break My Soul" and "Cuff It." Other notable tracks include "I'm That Girl," "Alien Superstar," and "Summer Renaissance." The album's closing track, "Summer Renaissance," is a sprawling epic that incorporates elements of jazz and classical music.

# Promotion and release

## Singles

Renaissance was preceded by the release of two singles: "Break My Soul" and "Cuff It." "Break My Soul" was released on June 20, 2022, and debuted at number one on the US Billboard Hot 100 chart. The song features a driving beat and a catchy hook, with lyrics that explore themes of freedom and empowerment.

"Cuff It" was released on August 12, 2022, and features a more upbeat, disco-inspired sound. The song's lyrics explore themes of love and desire, with Beyonc√© delivering a sultry, seductive vocal performance.

## Tour

Beyonc√© has announced a world tour in support of Renaissance, which is scheduled to begin in May 2023. The tour will feature a range of creative collaborators, including designers, choreographers, and visual artists. The tour is expected to feature a range of elaborate costumes, sets, and visual effects.

## Visuals

Renaissance has been accompanied by a range of visual content, including music videos, promotional films, and social media posts. The album's music videos have been praised for their creativity and style, with "Break My Soul" featuring a range of striking images and "Cuff It" showcasing Beyonc√©'s dance skills.

## Renaissance Couture

Beyonc√© has also launched a fashion line, Renaissance Couture, which features a range of elaborate costumes and accessories inspired by the album. The line includes a range of items, from statement pieces to everyday wear, and is available through Beyonc√©'s website and select retailers.

# Reception

## Critical response

Renaissance has received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the album's creative ambition, lyrical depth, and sonic innovation. The album has been described as a "masterpiece" and a " landmark album" by various critics, with many noting its potential for long-term impact and influence.

## Featured, sampled and interpolated artists

Renaissance features a range of collaborations, including producers, songwriters, and musicians from various genres. The album includes samples and interpolations from a range of artists, including Donna Summer, Giorgio Moroder, and Kendrick Lamar.

# Accolades

## Awards

Renaissance has been nominated for a range of awards, including the Grammy Awards and the MTV Video Music Awards. The album has won several awards, including the BET Soul Train Award for Album of the Year.

## Year-end rankings

Renaissance has appeared on several year-end rankings, including the Rolling Stone 500 Greatest Albums of All Time and the Billboard 200 Year-End chart.

# Commercial performance

## United States

Renaissance debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart, with over 300,000 units sold in its first week. The album has been certified platinum by the RIAA and has spent several weeks at number one on the Billboard 200 chart.

## Internationally

Renaissance has performed strongly internationally, reaching number one on the UK Albums Chart, the Australian Albums Chart, and the Canadian Albums Chart. The album has also reached the top 10 in several other countries, including Germany, France, and Italy.

# Legacy

Renaissance is expected to have a significant impact on popular music, with many noting its potential for long-term influence and innovation. The album's creative ambition, lyrical depth, and sonic innovation have already inspired a range of artists and fans, and it is likely to be remembered as a landmark album in Beyonc√©'s career.

The UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments will be the collegiate volleyball tournaments of the University Athletic Association of the Philippines (UAAP) for the 2022-2023 school year. The UAAP Season 85 volleyball tournaments will follow a single-round robin format, where each team will play against the other teams once. article:
2022 United States Senate Elections

The 2022 United States Senate elections were held on November 8, 2022, with 34 of the 100 seats in the Senate being contested. The elections were part of the 2022 United States elections and were held concurrently with the 2022 United States House of Representatives elections and various state and local elections.

# Partisan Composition

The partisan composition of the Senate before the elections was 50 Republicans, 48 Democrats, and 2 Independents who caucused with the Democrats. The elections resulted in the Democrats maintaining control of the Senate, with the party composition changing to 48 Democrats, 49 Republicans, and 3 Independents who caucused with the Democrats.

# Summary Results

## Seats

The Democrats won 21 seats, while the Republicans won 13 seats. There were no third-party or independent winners.

## Votes

The total number of votes cast in the Senate elections was over 49 million. The Democrats received over 25 million votes, while the Republicans received over 23 million votes.

# Closest Races

Several Senate races were closely contested, with the following being the closest:

* Pennsylvania: John Fetterman (D) defeated Mehmet Oz (R) by a margin of 0.8%
* Arizona: Mark Kelly (D) defeated Blake Masters (R) by a margin of 1.1%
* Wisconsin: Ron Johnson (R) defeated Mandela Barnes (D) by a margin of 1.2%

# Change in Composition

## Before the Elections

Before the elections, the Senate had 50 Republicans, 48 Democrats, and 2 Independents who caucused with the Democrats.

## After the Elections

After the elections, the Senate had 48 Democrats, 49 Republicans, and 3 Independents who caucused with the Democrats.

## Beginning of the First Session

The first session of the 118th Congress began on January 3, 2023. The Senate composition at the beginning of the session was 48 Democrats, 49 Republicans, and 3 Independents who caucused with the Democrats.

# Final Pre-Election Predictions

Several election forecasters made predictions about the outcome of the Senate elections. The Cook Political Report predicted that the Democrats would win 20-22 seats, while the Republicans would win 13-15 seats. The Sabato Crystal Ball predicted that the Democrats would win 21-23 seats, while the Republicans would win 12-14 seats.

# Gains and Holds

## Retirements

* Richard Burr (R-NC)
* Pat Toomey (R-PA)

## Resignations

## Post-Election Changes

* Kyrsten Sinema (D-AZ) - switched to Independent

article:
Tropical Cyclones in 2022

Introduction:
Tropical cyclones are intense, rotating low-pressure weather systems that form over warm ocean waters in the tropics. These storms can bring catastrophic damage and loss of life to affected areas. The year 2022 saw a significant number of tropical cyclones form around the world, with various regions experiencing their own unique set of storms. This article provides an overview of the global atmospheric and hydrological conditions that led to the formation of these storms, as well as a summary of the tropical cyclones that occurred in each region.

# Global Atmospheric and Hydrological Conditions

The global atmospheric and hydrological conditions in 2022 were influenced by several climate patterns, including the El Ni√±o-Southern Oscillation (ENSO), the Pacific Decadal Oscillation (PDO), and the Indian Ocean Dipole (IOD). These patterns can impact the formation and trajectory of tropical cyclones.

The ENSO cycle was in a neutral phase during the early part of 2022, but shifted to a La Ni√±a event in the latter half of the year. This transition led to increased rainfall in the Pacific and Indian Oceans, which in turn contributed to the formation of tropical cyclones.

The PDO was in a positive phase, which typically leads to increased hurricane activity in the Pacific. The IOD was in a negative phase, which tends to enhance the formation of tropical cyclones in the Indian Ocean.

# Summary

## North Atlantic Ocean

The 2022 Atlantic hurricane season was slightly above average, with 14 named storms, 8 hurricanes, and 2 major hurricanes. The season began on June 5 with the formation of Tropical Storm Alex, and ended on November 30 with the dissipation of Tropical Storm Nicole.

## Eastern & Central Pacific Ocean

The 2022 Eastern Pacific hurricane season was near-average, with 19 named storms, 10 hurricanes, and 4 major hurricanes. The season began on May 28 with the formation of Tropical Storm Agatha, and ended on November 30 with the dissipation of Tropical Storm Kenneth.

## Western Pacific Ocean

The 2022 Pacific typhoon season was above-average, with 25 named storms, 13 typhoons, and 5 super typhoons. The season began on January 1 with the formation of Tropical Storm Pabuk, and ended on December 31 with the dissipation of Tropical Storm Pakhar.

## North Indian Ocean

The 2022 North Indian Ocean cyclone season was below-average, with 4 named storms, 2 cyclones, and 1 severe cyclone. The season began on March 5 with the formation of Cyclonic Storm Asani, and ended on December 5 with the dissipation of Cyclonic Storm Sitrang.

## South-West Indian Ocean

### January - June

The 2022 South-West Indian Ocean cyclone season was above-average, with 6 named storms, 3 tropical cyclones, and 2 intense tropical cyclones. The season began on January 19 with the formation of Tropical Storm Ana, and ended on June 30 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Freddy.

### July - December

The second half of the season saw an increase in activity, with 7 named storms, 4 tropical cyclones, and 2 intense tropical cyclones. The season ended on December 31 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Darian.

## Australian Region

### January - June

The 2022 Australian region cyclone season was above-average, with 5 named storms, 3 tropical cyclones, and 1 severe tropical cyclone. The season began on January 10 with the formation of Tropical Storm Tiffany, and ended on June 30 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Karim.

### July - December

The second half of the season saw a decrease in activity, with 3 named storms, 2 tropical cyclones, and 1 severe tropical cyclone. The season ended on December 31 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Ellie.

## South Pacific Ocean

### January - June

The 2022 South Pacific Ocean cyclone season was above-average, with 4 named storms, 2 tropical cyclones, and 1 severe tropical cyclone. The season began on January 3 with the formation of Tropical Storm Cody, and ended on June 30 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Fili.

### July - December

The second half of the season saw a decrease in activity, with 2 named storms, 1 tropical cyclone, and 1 severe tropical cyclone. The season ended on December 31 with the dissipation of Tropical Cyclone Yasi.

## South Atlantic Ocean

The 2022 South Atlantic Ocean cyclone season was below-average, with 1 named storm, 1 subtropical storm, and 1 tropical cyclone. The season began on February 23 with the formation of Subtropical Storm 01Q, and ended on March 23 with the dissipation of Tropical Storm Iman.

# Global Effects

article:
**Speak Now (Taylor's Version)**

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) is the re-recorded version of American singer-songwriter Taylor Swift's third studio album, Speak Now. Released on July 7, 2023, the album marks the third re-recorded album by Swift, following Fearless (Taylor's Version) and Red (Taylor's Version). The re-recording of Speak Now comes as a result of Swift's highly publicized dispute with her former record label, Big Machine Records, over ownership of her master recordings.

**Background**

In June 2019, it was announced that Scooter Braun's company, Ithaca Holdings, had acquired Big Machine Records, Swift's former record label, for $300 million. The deal included ownership of Swift's master recordings from her 2006 debut album to 2017's reputation. Swift publicly expressed her disapproval of the deal, stating that she had not been given the opportunity to purchase her master recordings herself and that Braun's ownership was a "worst-case scenario" for her. In August 2020, Swift announced that she would be re-recording her old albums in an effort to regain control over her music and master recordings.

**Music and Lyrics**

## Composition

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) features re-recorded versions of the original album's 14 tracks, as well as six additional tracks "From the Vault". The re-recorded tracks feature updated production and instrumentation, while maintaining the original lyrics and melodies. Swift worked with producers Jack Antonoff and Aaron Dessner, who also produced tracks on her 2020 albums Folklore and Evermore, to create a new sound that blends her country roots with pop and rock influences.

## "From the Vault" tracks

The six "From the Vault" tracks are songs that Swift wrote and recorded during the original Speak Now sessions, but were ultimately not included on the final album. These tracks offer a glimpse into Swift's songwriting process and provide additional insight into the themes and emotions that she explored on the original album. The "From the Vault" tracks are notable for their raw, introspective quality, and demonstrate Swift's ability to craft compelling stories and characters in her songwriting.

**Release**

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) was released on July 7, 2023, through Republic Records. The album was available on various formats, including CD, vinyl, and digital streaming platforms. Swift announced the album's release through social media, sharing a series of cryptic messages and visuals that hinted at the album's themes and sound.

**Critical Reception**

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised Swift's re-recorded vocals and the updated production, which brought new life to the original songs. The "From the Vault" tracks were also widely praised, with many critics noting that they were among the strongest tracks on the album. The album holds a Metacritic score of 88 out of 100, based on 22 reviews, indicating "universal acclaim".

**Commercial Performance**

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) debuted at number one on the US Billboard 200 chart, with over 300,000 copies sold in its first week. The album also reached number one on the UK Albums Chart and the Australian Albums Chart, among others. The album's success marked Swift's 10th number-one album in the US, and further solidified her position as one of the most successful artists of the 21st century.

**Recognition**

Speak Now (Taylor's Version) has been recognized as one of the best albums of 2023 by various publications, including Rolling Stone, Billboard, and NME. The album's success has also been notable for its impact on the music industry, as it has helped to raise awareness about artists' rights and the importance of owning one's master recordings.

article:
2022 World Women's Curling Championship

The 2022 World Women's Curling Championship was held from March 19 to 27, 2022, at the CN Centre in Prince George, British Columbia, Canada. The event was the 43rd edition of the World Women's Curling Championship, and it featured 13 teams from around the world competing for the championship title.

# Qualification

The qualification process for the 2022 World Women's Curling Championship was based on the results of the 2021 World Women's Curling Championship and the 2021 European Curling Championships. The top seven teams from the 2021 World Women's Curling Championship earned direct qualification, while the top two teams from the 2021 European Curling Championships also qualified. Additionally, the top team from the 2021 Americas Challenge earned a spot in the championship.

## Russian participation

On February 28, 2022, the World Curling Federation announced that the Russian Curling Federation would not be allowed to participate in the 2022 World Women's Curling Championship due to the Russian invasion of Ukraine. This decision was made in accordance with the International Olympic Committee's recommendation to suspend Russian and Belarusian athletes from competing in international events.

## COVID-19 issues

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the 2022 World Women's Curling Championship. Several teams faced challenges related to the pandemic, including travel restrictions and positive cases among team members.

### Scotland

The Scottish team, skipped by Eve Muirhead, was forced to withdraw from the championship due to a positive COVID-19 case among their team members. Scotland was replaced by the Norwegian team, which was the highest-ranked team not already qualified.

### Japan

The Japanese team, skipped by Satsuki Fujisawa, was also affected by the COVID-19 pandemic. The team's alternate, Yumi Suzuki, tested positive for COVID-19 and was unable to compete in the championship. Japan was allowed to continue competing with a reduced team.

2022 Welsh Open (snooker)
==========================

The 2022 Welsh Open was a professional snooker tournament that took place from 28 February to 6 March 2022 at the ICC Wales in Newport, Wales. It was the 31st edition of the Welsh Open and the 13th ranking event of the 2021-22 snooker season.

Format
--------

The tournament featured 128 players competing in a single-elimination format, with the top 16 players in the world rankings seeded through to the last 64 stage. The remaining players competed in the qualifying rounds, with the winners advancing to the main draw. The matches were played as best-of-seven frames, with the exception of the semi-finals and final, which were played as best-of-11 frames.

The early rounds saw several upsets, with world number 12, David Gilbert, and world number 15, Barry Hawkins, both losing to lower-ranked opponents.

2023 Atlantic Hurricane Season

The 2023 Atlantic hurricane season was the current season of tropical cyclones in the Atlantic Ocean, officially starting on June 1, 2023, and ending on November 30, 2023. The season produced a total of 21 named storms, 7 hurricanes, and 3 major hurricanes. The season was marked by a relatively slow start, with the first named storm not developing until late June. However, the season picked up in August and September, with several intense hurricanes affecting the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

# Seasonal Forecasts

## Pre-season Forecasts

Prior to the start of the season, several forecast agencies released predictions for the upcoming season. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) predicted a near-normal season, with 12-17 named storms, 6-10 hurricanes, and 2-4 major hurricanes. The Weather Research Center (WRC) predicted a slightly above-normal season, with 14-18 named storms, 7-11 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes. Other agencies, such as the Colorado State University (CSU) and the Tropical Meteorology Project (TMP), also predicted a near-normal to slightly above-normal season.

## Mid-season Forecasts

In early August, several forecast agencies released mid-season updates. NOAA revised their prediction to 15-20 named storms, 7-12 hurricanes, and 3-5 major hurricanes. The WRC also revised their prediction to 16-22 named storms, 8-14 hurricanes, and 4-6 major hurricanes. The CSU and TMP also revised their predictions to slightly above-normal.

# Seasonal Summary

## Background

The 2023 Atlantic hurricane season was influenced by several climate patterns, including the El Ni√±o-Southern Oscillation (ENSO) and the North Atlantic Oscillation (NAO). The ENSO was in a neutral phase during the summer and fall, which is typically associated with a slightly above-normal hurricane season. The NAO was in a positive phase, which is typically associated with a stronger subtropical high and a more active hurricane season.

## Early Activity

The season started slowly, with the first named storm, Arlene, not developing until June 28. Arlene was a short-lived tropical storm that affected the southeastern United States. The next named storm, Bret, developed on July 18 and affected the Caribbean.

## Peak to Late Activity

The season picked up in August and September, with several intense hurricanes affecting the Caribbean and the southeastern United States. Hurricane Don developed on August 15 and affected the Caribbean and the southeastern United States. Hurricane Idalia developed on August 20 and affected the Caribbean and the southeastern United States. Hurricane Lee developed on September 1 and affected the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

2022 AFL Grand Final

The 2022 AFL Grand Final was the 126th annual Grand Final of the Australian Football League (AFL), the highest level of competition in Australian rules football. The match was contested between the Geelong Cats and the Sydney Swans at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) on September 24, 2022. The Geelong Cats emerged victorious, winning the match by a margin of 81 points.

# Background

The 2022 AFL season was marked by significant challenges, including the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic and player injuries. Despite these obstacles, the season saw several teams competing for a spot in the finals series. The Geelong Cats, led by coach Chris Scott, finished the home-and-away season in first place on the ladder, earning the minor premiership. The Sydney Swans, under the guidance of coach John Longmire, finished fourth on the ladder. Both teams progressed through the finals series, with the Cats defeating the Collingwood Magpies in the preliminary final and the Swans overcoming the Collingwood Magpies in the other preliminary final.

# Ceremonies and entertainment

The 2022 AFL Grand Final featured a range of ceremonies and entertainment events, showcasing Australian music and culture.

## Parade

The traditional Grand Final parade was held on the Friday before the match, with players from both teams participating in the event. The parade began at the Old Treasury Building and made its way through the streets of Melbourne, concluding at the Melbourne Cricket Ground. Thousands of fans lined the streets to catch a glimpse of their favorite players.

## On-field events

Prior to the match, the crowd was treated to a range of on-field entertainment, including a performance by Australian singer-songwriter, Vance Joy. The pre-game show also featured a tribute to the Indigenous heritage of Australian football, with a traditional smoking ceremony and a performance by Indigenous musician, Christine Anu.

# Match summary

The 2022 AFL Grand Final was a one-sided contest, with the Geelong Cats dominating the Sydney Swans from the opening quarter.

## First quarter

The Cats began the match strongly, kicking three goals in the opening quarter to the Swans' one. The Cats' midfielders, led by Joel Selwood and Patrick Dangerfield, controlled the tempo of the game, providing a strong platform for their forwards.

## Second quarter

The Cats continued to assert their dominance in the second quarter, kicking four goals to the Swans' two. The Cats' forwards, including Tom Hawkins and Jeremy Cameron, were a major factor in their team's success, with their marking and goal-kicking proving too much for the Swans' defense.

## Third quarter

The Swans attempted to mount a comeback in the third quarter, kicking three goals to the Cats' two. However, the Cats' lead was too great, and they maintained a comfortable margin heading into the final quarter.

## Final quarter

The final quarter was a procession for the Cats, who kicked five goals to the Swans' one. The Cats' victory was sealed when Tom Hawkins kicked his fifth goal of the match, sparking celebrations among the Cats' players and supporters.

## Overall

The Geelong Cats emerged victorious, winning the match by a margin of 81 points. The Cats' dominance was reflected in the final score, with the Cats kicking 20 goals to the Swans' six.

## Norm Smith Medal

The Norm Smith Medal, awarded to the best player on the field, was won by the Cats' midfielder, Isaac Smith. Smith's performance was marked by his exceptional skill and work rate, with the veteran midfielder playing a key role in the Cats' victory.

article:
WrestleMania 38
================

WrestleMania 38 was the 38th annual WrestleMania professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by WWE. It took place on April 2 and 3, 2022, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas.

Production
----------

### Background

WrestleMania 38 was first announced on April 3, 2021, during WrestleMania 37. The event was originally scheduled to take place at the SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California, but due to scheduling conflicts, it was later moved to the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas. This marked the third time that WrestleMania was held in the state of Texas, following WrestleMania 25 in 2009 and WrestleMania 32 in 2016.

### Broadcast outlets

WrestleMania 38 was available to stream on the WWE Network in over 180 countries, as well as on traditional pay-per-view. The event was also available to purchase through various cable and satellite providers.

### Celebrity involvement

Several celebrities were involved in WrestleMania 38, including Logan Paul, who made his WWE in-ring debut, and Pat McAfee, who served as a color commentator for the event.

### Other WrestleMania Week events

WrestleMania Week featured several events, including the WWE Hall of Fame ceremony, which took place on April 1, 2022. The ceremony honored the Class of 2022, which included The Undertaker, Vader, and Sharmell, among others.

### Storylines

#### Main event matches

The main event of Night 1 saw WWE Champion Roman Reigns defend his title against Seth Rollins, while the main event of Night 2 saw Brock Lesnar defend the WWE Universal Championship against Roman Reigns.

#### Undercard matches

Other notable matches on the card included Drew McIntyre vs. Happy Corbin, Ronda Rousey vs. Charlotte Flair for the SmackDown Women's Championship, and RK-Bro vs. The Usos vs. The Street Profits for the Raw and SmackDown Tag Team Championships.

Event
------

### Night 1

#### Preliminary matches

The event kicked off with a match between Drew McIntyre and Happy Corbin, which McIntyre won. This was followed by a match between Rey Mysterio and The Miz, which Mysterio won. The next match saw Logan Paul team up with The Miz to take on Rey Mysterio and Dominik Mysterio, which Paul and Miz won.

#### Main event

The main event of Night 1 saw WWE Champion Roman Reigns defend his title against Seth Rollins. Reigns won the match, retaining his title.

### Night 2

#### Preliminary matches

The second night of the event kicked off with a match between Randy Orton and Riddle vs. The Street Profits vs. The Usos for the Raw and SmackDown Tag Team Championships. The Usos won the match, retaining their titles. This was followed by a match between AJ Styles vs. Edge, which Styles won.

#### Main event

The main event of Night 2 saw Brock Lesnar defend the WWE Universal Championship against Roman Reigns. Lesnar won the match, retaining his title.

Reception
----------

WrestleMania 38 received generally positive reviews from critics and fans. The event was praised for its strong in-ring performances, as well as its well-booked matches.

Aftermath
----------

### Raw

The night after WrestleMania, on Raw, several new feuds were set up, including a feud between Cody Rhodes and Seth Rollins.

### SmackDown

On SmackDown, Ronda Rousey challenged Charlotte Flair to a rematch for the SmackDown Women's Championship, which Rousey won.

Results
-------

### Night 1

* Drew McIntyre defeated Happy Corbin
* Rey Mysterio defeated The Miz
* Logan Paul and The Miz defeated Rey Mysterio and Dominik Mysterio
* WWE Champion Roman Reigns defeated Seth Rollins

### Night 2

* The Usos defeated Randy Orton and Riddle vs. The Street Profits to retain the Raw and SmackDown Tag Team Championships
* AJ Styles defeated Edge
* WWE Universal Champion Brock Lesnar defeated Roman Reigns

Notes
-----

* WrestleMania 38 marked the first time that the event was held over two nights.
* The event set a new record for the highest-grossing event in WWE history.

References
----------

External links

# 2023 AFL season

The 2023 Australian Football League season was the 127th season of the elite Australian rules football competition and the 34th under the name 'Australian Football League', having switched from 'Victorian Football League' in 1990. The season began on Thursday, March 16, 2023, and concluded on Saturday, September 30, 2023.

# Background

The 2023 season saw significant changes to the AFL, including the introduction of a new collective bargaining agreement, which increased player salaries and benefits. The league also introduced a new concussion protocol, aimed at improving player safety.

# Coach appointments

Several coaching changes occurred in the off-season. The most notable was the appointment of Damien Hardwick as the new senior coach of the Gold Coast Suns, replacing Stuart Dew. Other coaching changes included the appointment of Alastair Clarkson as the new senior coach of the North Melbourne Football Club, replacing David Noble.

# Club leadership

Several clubs underwent changes in leadership positions. The most notable was the appointment of Andrew Dillon as the new chief executive officer of the Carlton Football Club, replacing Cain Liddle.

# Pre-season

article:
Michelle Yeoh
================

Michelle Yeoh Choo-kheng is a Malaysian actress, best known for her extensive work in Hong Kong action cinema and her iconic roles in international films. With a career spanning over four decades, Yeoh has established herself as one of the most successful and influential actresses in the entertainment industry.

Early life and education
-------------------------

Michelle Yeoh was born on August 6, 1962, in Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia. She is the daughter of Janet Yeoh and Yeoh Kian-teik, a lawyer and politician. Yeoh's parents were of Chinese descent, and she was raised in a traditional Chinese family. She began ballet lessons at the age of four and later moved to London to study at the Royal Academy of Dance.

However, Yeoh's academic pursuits were cut short when she suffered a spinal injury, which forced her to abandon her ballet career. She then returned to Malaysia and enrolled in a beauty pageant, which marked the beginning of her journey in the entertainment industry.

Career
--------

### Early career and first retirement (1983‚Äì1991)

Yeoh's entry into the entertainment industry began with her participation in the Miss Malaysia World beauty pageant in 1983, where she won the title. She then represented Malaysia at the Miss World 1983 pageant, where she was crowned Miss Malaysia World.

Yeoh's early career in film began with the 1984 Hong Kong action film "The Owl vs Bombo," followed by a string of low-budget films. Her breakthrough role came in 1985 with the film "Yes, Madam," which showcased her impressive action skills.

However, Yeoh's early career was marked by a series of injuries, including a near-fatal accident during the filming of "Yes, Madam." In 1991, she announced her retirement from acting to focus on her personal life.

### Return as an action star (1992‚Äì2001)

Yeoh's retirement was short-lived, as she returned to the film industry in 1992 with the action film "Police Story 3: Supercop." Her performance in the film earned her widespread recognition, and she went on to become one of the most successful action stars in Hong Kong.

Throughout the 1990s, Yeoh appeared in a string of successful films, including "The Heroic Trio," "Holy Weapon," and "Wing Chun." Her performances showcased her impressive martial arts skills, and she became known as the "Queen of Martial Arts."

### Career fluctuations (2002‚Äì2016)

In the early 2000s, Yeoh's career experienced a decline, with a string of unsuccessful films. However, she continued to appear in a range of films, including the critically acclaimed "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" in 2000.

In the mid-2000s, Yeoh began to focus on more dramatic roles, including her performances in "Memoirs of a Geisha" and "Babylon A.D." While these films received mixed reviews, they marked a significant departure from her earlier action-oriented roles.

### Supporting roles (2017‚Äì2020)

In the late 2010s, Yeoh began to focus on supporting roles, including her performances in "Star Trek: Discovery" and "Crazy Rich Asians." Her performances in these films earned her widespread recognition, and she became known as one of the most successful actresses in Hollywood.

### Award success (2021‚Äìpresent)

In 2021, Yeoh's career experienced a significant resurgence with her starring role in the film "Everything Everywhere All at Once." The film earned widespread critical acclaim, and Yeoh's performance earned her numerous awards, including the Academy Award for Best Actress.

Activism
----------

Throughout her career, Yeoh has been an outspoken advocate for women's rights and environmental causes. In 2008, she was appointed as a Goodwill Ambassador for the United Nations Development Programme, where she focused on promoting sustainable development and reducing poverty.

In 2018, Yeoh was appointed as a Global Ambassador for the Save the Children organization, where she focused on promoting children's rights and education.

Personal life
-------------

Yeoh has been married twice, first to Hong Kong entrepreneur Dickson Poon from 1988 to 1992, and then to Frenchman Jean Todt in 2004. She has no children.

article:
2023 Nigerien Coup d'√©tat

The 2023 Nigerien coup d'√©tat was a military takeover that occurred on 26 July 2023, in Niger, a landlocked country in West Africa. The coup led to the overthrow of President Mohamed Bazoum, who had been in office since April 2021. This article provides an overview of the events leading up to the coup, the coup itself, and its aftermath.

# Background

Niger has a history of political instability, with multiple coups having taken place since the country gained independence from France in 1960. In 2010, a military junta overthrew President Mamadou Tandja, who had been in office since 1999. The 2010 coup led to a transition period, during which a new constitution was adopted and elections were held in 2011. However, the country continued to face challenges, including poverty, corruption, and insecurity.

In 2021, Mohamed Bazoum, a former prime minister and leader of the Nigerien Party for Democracy and Socialism (PNDS), won the presidential election. Bazoum's government faced significant challenges, including a growing Islamist insurgency and a worsening economic crisis. The government's response to these challenges was criticized by some as inadequate, leading to growing discontent among the population.

# Events

## 26 July

### Bazoum's detention

On 26 July 2023, President Mohamed Bazoum was detained by a group of soldiers at the presidential palace in Niamey, the capital city of Niger. The soldiers, who were reportedly from the presidential guard, took control of the palace and surrounding areas. The reasons for Bazoum's detention were not immediately clear, but it was reported that the soldiers were dissatisfied with the government's handling of the country's security crisis.

### Military mobilization

Following Bazoum's detention, a military mobilization was underway in Niamey. Soldiers were deployed across the city, and key infrastructure, including the airport and major roads, were secured. The military also took control of the state television and radio stations, which were used to broadcast messages to the public.

### Announcement of Bazoum's overthrow

Later in the day, a group of military officers, led by General Abdourahamane Tchiani, appeared on state television to announce that Bazoum had been overthrown. The officers claimed that the coup was necessary to restore stability and security in the country, which they said had been compromised by the government's ineptitude.

## 27 July

### Bazoum's response

On 27 July, Bazoum released a statement condemning the coup and calling for his supporters to remain calm. He claimed that the coup was unconstitutional and that he was still the legitimate president of Niger. However, it was unclear whether Bazoum had any real authority, as the military had taken control of the country.

### Military recognition of the junta

The military officers who had overthrown Bazoum established a new government, known as the National Council for the Safeguard of the Homeland (CNSP). The CNSP was recognized by the military as the new authority in Niger, and General Tchiani was appointed as its leader.

## 28 July

The CNSP announced that it would establish a transition government, which would lead the country to new elections. The CNSP also promised to restore stability and security in Niger, which it said had been compromised by the previous government.

# Aftermath

The coup had significant consequences for Niger. The country was plunged into a period of uncertainty, as the new government struggled to establish its authority. The international community condemned the coup, and many countries imposed sanctions on Niger.

The coup also had significant humanitarian consequences. Many people were displaced, and there were reports of human rights abuses by the military. The country's economy, which was already fragile, was further weakened by the coup.

# Reactions

## Domestic

The reaction to the coup in Niger was mixed. Some people welcomed the overthrow of Bazoum's government, which they saw as corrupt and ineffective. Others were opposed to the coup, which they saw as unconstitutional and undemocratic.

## International

The international community condemned the coup, with many countries calling for the restoration of the democratically elected government. The African Union and the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) both suspended Niger's membership, pending the restoration of democratic rule.

# Analysis

The 2023 Nigerien coup d'√©tat was a significant event in the country's history. It highlighted the ongoing challenges facing Niger, including poverty, corruption, and insecurity. The coup also raised questions about the role of the military in politics and the need for democratic reforms.

The coup had significant consequences for Niger and the wider region. It highlighted the need for greater international cooperation to address the challenges facing West Africa, including the spread of Islamist extremism and the need for economic development.

article:
Typhoon Hinnamnor

Typhoon Hinnamnor was a powerful tropical cyclone that affected Japan and South Korea in September 2022. The storm caused significant damage and disruption to both countries, particularly in the southern regions. This article provides an overview of the meteorological history, preparations, impact, and aftermath of Typhoon Hinnamnor.

#Meteorological history

Typhoon Hinnamnor formed on August 28, 2022, as a tropical depression over the western Pacific Ocean. The system gradually intensified, becoming a tropical storm on August 30 and a typhoon on September 1. Hinnamnor continued to strengthen, reaching its peak intensity on September 4 with maximum sustained winds of 195 km/h (120 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 920 hPa (27.17 inHg).

The typhoon began to move northward, passing close to the Japanese island of Okinawa on September 5. Hinnamnor then turned northeastward, making landfall on the southern coast of South Korea on September 6. The storm brought heavy rainfall and strong winds to both countries, causing widespread damage and disruption.

#Preparations

##Japan

In preparation for the storm, the Japanese government issued warnings and advisories for several prefectures, including Okinawa and Kagoshima. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) warned of strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surges along the coast. The government also set up emergency shelters and evacuation centers for those in need.

The Okinawa Prefectural Government took additional measures, including cancelling flights and ferry services, and closing schools and public facilities. The government also deployed troops to assist with evacuations and disaster response.

##South Korea

In South Korea, the government issued a typhoon alert for the southern regions, including Busan and Jeju Island. The Korea Meteorological Administration (KMA) warned of heavy rainfall, strong winds, and storm surges along the coast.

The government set up emergency shelters and evacuation centers, and deployed troops to assist with disaster response. The Ministry of the Interior and Safety also activated the National Crisis Management Center to coordinate disaster response efforts.

##Elsewhere

In other countries, including Taiwan and the Philippines, the storm caused strong winds and heavy rainfall, but no significant damage or casualties were reported.

#Impact

##Japan

In Japan, the storm caused significant damage and disruption, particularly in the southern regions. Strong winds and heavy rainfall caused widespread power outages, with over 100,000 households affected. The storm also caused landslides and flooding, with several rivers overflowing their banks.

The Okinawa Prefectural Government reported over 1,000 homes damaged or destroyed, with several buildings and infrastructure also affected. The storm also caused disruptions to transportation, with several flights and ferry services cancelled.

##South Korea

In South Korea, the storm caused widespread damage and disruption, particularly in the southern regions. Strong winds and heavy rainfall caused widespread power outages, with over 300,000 households affected. The storm also caused landslides and flooding, with several rivers overflowing their banks.

The government reported over 10,000 homes damaged or destroyed, with several buildings and infrastructure also affected. The storm also caused disruptions to transportation, with several flights and ferry services cancelled.

##Elsewhere

In other countries, including Taiwan and the Philippines, the storm caused strong winds and heavy rainfall, but no significant damage or casualties were reported.

#Retirement

Due to the significant damage and disruption caused by the storm, the name "Hinnamnor" was retired from the list of tropical cyclone names in the western Pacific Ocean.

article:
Tropical Storm Megi

Tropical Storm Megi was a tropical cyclone that affected the Philippines and China in April 2022. The storm was the first named storm of the 2022 Pacific typhoon season and caused significant damage and loss of life in the affected regions.

#Meteorological history

## Formation and intensification

Tropical Storm Megi formed on April 8, 2022, as a tropical depression in the Philippine Sea. The system slowly intensified as it moved northwestward, becoming a tropical storm on April 10. Megi continued to strengthen, reaching its peak intensity on April 12 with maximum sustained winds of 65 mph (105 km/h) and a minimum central pressure of 994 mbar.

## Movement and landfall

Megi made landfall in the Eastern Samar province of the Philippines on April 12, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the region. The storm then moved northward, passing over the islands of Leyte and Cebu, before re-emerging into the South China Sea. Megi made its second landfall in the province of Guangdong, China on April 14.

## Dissipation

Megi rapidly weakened after its second landfall, dissipating on April 15 as it moved inland.

#Preparations

## Philippines

The Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) issued several warnings and advisories as Megi approached the country. The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) activated its emergency response protocols, deploying personnel and equipment to affected areas.

## China

The China Meteorological Administration (CMA) issued a yellow alert for the provinces of Guangdong and Fujian, warning of strong winds and heavy rainfall. The Guangdong Provincial Government activated its emergency response plan, deploying personnel and equipment to affected areas.

#Impact

## Philippines

Megi caused significant damage and loss of life in the Philippines. The storm made landfall in the Eastern Samar province, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall that caused widespread power outages and property damage. The provinces of Leyte and Cebu were also severely affected, with reports of landslides and flash flooding.

## China

Megi brought strong winds and heavy rainfall to the provinces of Guangdong and Fujian, causing significant damage and disruption. The storm made landfall in the province of Guangdong, causing widespread power outages and property damage. The province of Fujian was also severely affected, with reports of landslides and flash flooding.

## Economic impact

The economic impact of Megi was significant, with estimated damages of over $100 million. The storm caused widespread disruption to agriculture, industry, and transportation, with many businesses and services affected.

#Aftermath

## Relief efforts

The Philippine and Chinese governments launched relief efforts in the aftermath of the storm. The NDRRMC and the Guangdong Provincial Government deployed personnel and equipment to affected areas, providing aid and assistance to those affected.

## Recovery

The recovery efforts were ongoing in the months following the storm. The Philippine and Chinese governments worked to rebuild damaged infrastructure and restore basic services.

#Retirement

The name "Megi" was retired from the list of tropical cyclone names in the Western Pacific by the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) due to the significant damage and loss of life caused by the storm.

* Tropical cyclone naming

2022 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships

The 2022 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships was the 46th edition of the International Ice Hockey Federation's (IIHF) junior ice hockey tournament. The tournament was held in Edmonton and Red Deer, Alberta, Canada, from August 9 to 20, 2022.

Background
----------

### Preparations

The IIHF announced on May 28, 2020, that Canada would host the 2022 World Junior Ice Hockey Championships. The tournament was originally scheduled to take place in Gothenburg, Sweden, but the Swedish Ice Hockey Association withdrew as hosts due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Canada was chosen as the replacement host, with Edmonton and Red Deer selected as the host cities.

### Cancellation and rescheduling of tournament due to COVID-19

The tournament was initially scheduled to take place from December 26, 2021, to January 5, 2022. However, on December 29, 2021, the IIHF announced that the tournament would be cancelled due to a rise in COVID-19 cases among players and staff. The tournament was later rescheduled to take place from August 9 to 20, 2022.

### Sponsorship withdrawals and low attendance

The rescheduled tournament faced significant challenges, including sponsorship withdrawals and low attendance. Many sponsors withdrew their support due to the changed dates and the ongoing pandemic. Additionally, attendance was lower than expected, with many fans unable to attend due to travel restrictions and health concerns.
